conversations.content: My latest mission is to aid a priest in need.
The priest in question reported being watched by someone for a few days. He also noticed an unnatural number of accidents happening around him, leading him to believe his life was in danger.
With no one else to rely on, he turned to the apostles, given our impartial reputation.
What I wouldn't give to go home... This is setting my nerves on edge.
EEEEEK! I'm sorry! I'm so sorry! ...Oh, it's just a bird. False alarm.
*sigh* I know I can't turn tail in the middle of a mission, but boy do I wish I could.
Wait... Where IS everyone? Ugh. Being on my own just makes me even MORE uneasy. I want to go hooome...
This is the unmistakable smell of frankincense. Judging by the smoke wafting from the censer, someone must have been here very recently.
What was that?! Could that be the priest I'm here for?
Why is there a jail under the church? ...Oh!
You must be the one who asked for help! Thank goodness. All that eerie solitude was starting to get to me!
No way... This has got to be a joke.
He's...dead. But there's no sign of livor mortis, so he must have passed really recently. Which means—
What are you doing over there?!
EEEK! I... I'm not doing anything suspicious, I swear!
That priest is from our church! You did this, didn't you?!
Absolutely not! I came here to save him!
A likely story! You can tell us what REALLY happened in court. Men! Arrest that murderer!
Where did they come from?! There was no one here before!
We knew someone was targeting him, but never imagined it would be an apostle. How deplorable.
It seems the apostles' sterling reputation is but goldleaf plastered over rot.
Wait! Please, listen to me!
I have no words to spare for your kind!
Damn, you're built like a ROCK! How much do you train?!
Please! Put down your weapons and listen to me, I'm begging you!
Raaaah!
(I can't get through to them... Am I seriously going to be treated like a murderer now?)
What are you waiting for?! I order you to seize her—and finish her!
Ugh!
(This is hopeless. No matter how fervently I plead my innocence, they're not going to listen.)
Argh!
I'm so sorry! But I can't let you detain me on false charges, so...
In the name of the Goddess, I... I'm getting out of here!
She's so stro—GWAGH!
I've always been more cowardly than anyone else I know—and I've always detested that fact. This time was no different.
All I could think to do was run like the scaredy-cat I am...and that's what I did.
I loathe the spineless woman I see in the mirror. Day after day, I search desperately for something  I can cling to, forever holding back my tears.
How did she send my soldiers flying like a bunch of down pillows? She's a monster!
COME BACK HERE! After her, men!
Don't let that damned apostle get away!
*pant* *pant* Did I lose them?
I thought they were never gonna give up... Now the sun's gone down and my legs are DYING for a rest.
EEEK! A MONSTER!
Oh, it's just a cat. Sheesh, kitty! You almost gave me a heart attack!
Meooow.
Hee hee. That kitty sure was cute. Friendly, too, which might mean there's a village nearby.
Why does nighttime make everything so much scarier? If there IS a village around, I should head there to rest a spell.
GAH! Where's an inn when you need it?!
Phew... I've never felt so relieved to see people's lights on.
But they're probably gonna be wary if a stranger like me waltzes into their home...
Hi there.
GYAAAH! I'm sorry! I'm sorry! Don't eat me; I'm all sinew and gristle! Someone heeelp!
Whoa, easy! I live here in this village—and we don't eat people.
I came over because I thought you might need some help. I didn't think I'd make you jump outta your skin like that.
I'm so sorry... I'm just, uh, easily spooked, and the forest's so creepy at night that it's got me on edge.
Ha ha. You're not wrong there.
(Hm? This is the same acidic smell from before...)
I could set you up with a room for the  night if you want. You interested?
Are you sure? Oh, you're a lifesaver!
No prob. Just trying to be a good Samaritan.
You're really sure I can use this room?
Certainly. I've been filled in on your situation—it's not much, but it's a bed for the night.
If there's anything else you need, we can bring it to your room, so don't hesitate to let us know.
Oh, thank you! You're both far too kind.
Think nothing of it. But I would recommend you stay in your room until dawn breaks.
A wise suggestion. The forest is full of nocturnal fiends, and we don't want you getting hurt.
Oh, you don't need to tell me twice. I'm terrified of things that go bump in the night even at the best of times.
Sounds like you're all set, then.
We'll leave you in peace now. May the Goddess be with you.
...I'm just imagining things, right? I must be. Okay, let me get some rest.
This has been quite a day. I'm going to fall asleep the second my head hits the pillow. But I think I'll leave the light on, just in case.
Several hours later...
Huh? It's awfully late for there to be people talking so loudly outside.
...ready?
...in position. We have...surrounded.
Ha ha. Even if...apostle... ...powerless...asleep.
(One of those voices sounds like the man who invited me in! And did they just say they have this house surrounded?!)
(What do I do?! I've gotta run! But WHERE? It's pitch black outside!)
(Ugh... I hate the dark. But the thought of getting caught here is even scarier, so I have to buck up and do this!)
(Or maybe I should try and hold out here until someone comes to help? Although, who's to say help is coming in the first place? Raphael, what should I dooo...?)
MOVE IN!
Where is she?!
The window! She's trying to escape!
But we've got men outside there. What are they doing?!
They're all out cold!
Rrrrgh, AFTER HER! And tell the soldiers in the forest—we're gonna need their help in apprehending her!
*pant* *pant* I feel like I've run a marathon today...and now I'm back in this creepy forest! I am one hundred percent expecting to see a ghost at this point.
But I can't cause trouble for the others. I need to swallow my fear and shake my pursuers all on my own.
She can't have gone far. Don't leave a corner of this forest unchecked!
Why are they so darned persistent?! I need to get farther away from the village!
*pant* *pant* Surely they won't follow me this far. Wait... Isn't that—?
Hey there, Ryszarda. Figured you'd run this way.
Finally, some friendly faces! I'm so glad you're here to help.
Ow! That's not funny, Ramiel. You've always been a joker, but you're starting to scare me here.
This is no joke. Or do we need to make the situation a little clearer for you?
This can't be happening... We're both apostles! Friends!
We might both be apostles, but that just means we're fighting for the same thing. Friendship has nothing to do with it.
I'll do what I must to see a job done— even if that means facing a fellow apostle.
You dummy! You're always so quick to slack off, so why the serious act now?!
Because when you release your full potential, he and Basileus are the only ones able to compete.
When I get told I'm the only man for the job, I've gotta put my back into it. Y'know?
So in the Goddess's name, I hereby charge you with murder. You're coming with me.
You're not getting away!
(Ugh! They're both perfectly in sync with each other—and they're not holding back!)
They're on a completely different level from us. What do we even do here?
Please just stop this! I don't want to fight another apostle!
Gah! Her strength really is absurd. Good thing I brought Ramiel. No way I'd be able to take her alone.
Ramiel!
You don't need to tell me twice!
AAAGH!
Oh! Now's my chance!
Hey, she's getting away! AFTER HER!
What do you think you're doing?!
Oh, I am terribly sorry. You were making such a small contribution to the battle that I mistook you for a wall.
Grrr... So you're trying to tell me that was an accident?
'Course it was. But I'd hurry after them if I were you—you're gonna lose them.
Bah. The bishop will be hearing of this!
*sigh* What a joke.
Did you find her?!
Not yet! But she can't have gone far!
All right. Let's keep looking.
Phew... I finally lost them. But at this rate, it's only a matter of time before—
You're found? Well, searching for things IS my specialty.
Why are you so determined, Nevin?!
You must KNOW I'm not the murderer!
I told you—because I have my orders, and to us apostles, orders are absolute.
Rrrgh!
Surely he won't follow me this far.
Don't count on that. I know how you think.
How did you get here first?! I have to put some space between us!
This ends here.
(There's nowhere for me to run. Did they lure me here on purpose? Was this their plan all along?)
Then I can't afford to hold back!
Save it. Don't make this harder than it needs to be after I went to the effort of shaking off those pesky Templars.
I'm tired enough from having to run around in the dark like this. I just wanna get this over with.
What are you saying?
I don't have time to explain this in a way that'll make sense to you, so I'll cut right to the chase.
Pursuing you is an official mission. If you want those orders revoked, you'll need to prove your innocence.
But how...?
Normally, there'd be physical evidence in and around the church where the crime took place, but I'm guessing that's gone.
And if clues're a no-go, all that's left is getting caught and awaiting your fate.
That doesn't leave me with many options...
I have a message for you from Raphael.
You do?
＂Whenever you feel like cowardice is going to get the better of you, count on me and your friends, like I depend on you.＂
I heard this from Sandalphon rather than Raphael herself, mind you.
But if you were ordered to hunt me down, that means I can't depend on apostles OR angels.
Bingo. Everyone has friends, but you're not going to find what you need here.
Then what should I do?!
Listen to me—
I've found her! This way!
Stop talking to our target and finish her!
Well...see ya.
What do you—
Leave the Church side of things to me, and go find someone on the outside who can help you. May we next meet in the arms of the Goddess herself.
I...see. Very well, then.
Farewell, Ryszarda. Angelic Declaration!
AAAAH!
What an explosion! Even a mass of muscle like her couldn't survive a fall like that.
Heh. The apostles really are a bunch of monsters if they're able to turn on their own at the drop of a hat when the mission demands it.
Hey! What do you think you're doing?!
Don't you need to report to the bishop? We're leaving.
Hmph. I don't need YOU to tell me that!
*sigh* I dread to think how Raphael will react when she finds out about this.
Welcome back. Did you finish dealing with your comrade?
All sinners are equally culpable in the eyes of the Goddess, and must be punished—whoever they are.
I'm glad to hear that. Still, you will have some hard times ahead of you, now that the apostles are one woman down.
That's our problem, not yours. Now where's this murdered priest? I need to inspect his corpse.
Whatever do you need to do that for?
No matter how much I questioned her, I couldn't confirm our suspect did the deed. I figured I might learn something new from the body.
I'm afraid that won't be possible. The victim has already been buried.
Then I guess I'd better get a shovel.
You would dare disturb the eternal repose of the dead? Blasphemy, I say!
Is it? Or could it be that you don't want us finding something that incriminates you?
Spare me your baseless accusations. I am simply a man of faith who will not condone blasphemy.
See, I did a bit of digging on my own, and I learned that a few months ago, you suddenly became very negative towards the apostles and angels.
What of it?
Just what happened to you back then? Actually, no. Let me cut right to the chase.
Who did you meet?
I hope you aren't implying someone ordered me to do all of this to tarnish the apostles' reputation.
The only thing I'm guilty of is witnessing your friend murdering one of our priests. You can prove nothing more.
A fair response. Without solid evidence, no one would believe us.
Hah. I'm glad you understand. If you want to pin a crime on me, you'd best be able to back up your claims!
There's your cue, Ryszarda.
What?
YOU! How are you here?! You should be dead! Both he AND the Templars reported you were sent flying off a cliff!
She was—but I never said she died from it. It'd take more than a little tumble like that to finish her off.
Okay, I'm strong, but not THAT strong. I just got really lucky this time!
Curse you! Still, your luck ran out the second you showed your face here. You will atone for the murder of a priest with your death!
I... I'm not the one who killed him! It was YOU!
Ha ha ha. You're wasting your breath! Everyone has already accepted that the murder was your doing.
You're going to need concrete evidence to convince anyone that I was responsible!
I have some.
Ha ha... Wait, what?
Here's your evidence. He told me everything.
Wha—?! I mean, I've never met this man!
How could you say that, Father?!
Hah! You can't expect us to believe that when you're so visibly rattled.
After being sent flying off that cliff, I started looking for evidence that the murder was your doing.
I was sure you'd destroyed all the physical evidence...but that still left the chance one of your friends could testify against you.
Although I only really started looking into that possibility when Nevin and Ramiel half-ordered me to.
Ordered you, you say?
We could hardly order you directly, knowing that we were being watched by the Templars.
If we'd been too obvious, we might've been silenced. So we just...gave her a little push. Figuratively AND literally, in this case.
How were you both able to convey your intentions with such a brief exchange?!
I'm not all that smart, so I just did as I was told.
Nevin said I needed to look around for friends who could help me.
I just took Raphael's message to mean that I shouldn't give up as long as there are people who'd believe me, though.
And that message was the truth. So? Who is our friend here?
Rgh...
I met him near a village I reached trying to shake off the Templars' pursuit.
I'm impressed you managed to work out that he was in league with the bishop.
At first, I was thinking of picking a Templar at random and tying them up.
But there was no telling how much they even knew. Plus, I could've just ended up getting chased around again.
That was when I remembered him.
Your good old instincts again?
I might have gone after him on instinct, but I DID have reasons to suspect him.
He had the same smell of frankincense as the church where I met the bishop, and I heard him giving orders when people surrounded the house I was at.
Neither stand as infallible evidence...but they do make a convincing case for asking him a few questions.
She did a LOT more than ask me a few questions!
Because I'm so timid, I have a keen eye for people's facial expressions.
I can tell what they fear the most, and what will hurt them the most.
Eeep... Don't look at me! PLEASE!
The heck did you do to this poor sod?
I really did just talk to him, I promise! He told me that all of this was planned by the bishop.
His testimony proves you were the culprit! So...please come quietly!
Grr... I can't! I'd—
Don't listen to her, Templars! She spews nothing but LIES!
The apostles are heretics who use the Goddess's power to stain their hands with blood! They and the angels should be expelled from the Church at once!
Such caustic words. Whoever could have gotten you thinking like that?
Kill the apostles AND the angel! We can't let them have their way with the Church!
*sigh* Show our stubborn friend the will of the Goddess, you two.
I guess there's nothing else for it.
(Please, let me borrow a little of your power, Raphael.)
Bear witness to the Goddess's might!
A Church in North Grastaea
You really are an unpleasant person, Nevin.
What a thing to say! I'll have you know everyone always says what a fine piece of work I am.
That's not the compliment you think it is... But never mind you for now.
Ryszarda was telling me how much fun you seemed to be having cornering her during your mission.
I didn't have a choice! I couldn't act like I was on her side—and it gave me no joy to be fighting her, I assure you.
Although he has been known to enjoy venting his work frustrations like that in the past.
You keep your mouth shut!
If there's something you wanna say, go ahead and say it, Pinon.
I'm just thinking it's no wonder why everyone connected to the Church hates you.
Ouch. Tell Papa Bear how you REALLY feel. Anyway, where'd you get the idea people hate me? That hurts if it's true!
I... I'm so sorry I'm late!
I was attacked by bandits four times on the way here—I'm sorry! I don't want to sound like I'm making excuses!
That doesn't sound very enjoyable. Incidentally, have you spoken to Raphael since, well...the incident?
I can't say I have. Did she need something from me?
Oh, not especially. But after reporting the events that transpired, Sandalphon relayed her response, and she had some... choice words for me.
I'm so sorry. Um... What did she say?
She said something along the lines of, ＂I'M the only one allowed to chuck my li'l one off a cliff!＂
That's...not quite the complaint I was expecting.
Still your tongues and pay heed.
I have come to inform you of your next mission.
But first, I have further information concerning the mission with which three of you were recently involved.
About the apprehended bishop?
Correct. He took his own life.
What?! Then we didn't get anything out of him?!
Indeed. No testimony regarding the anti-apostle camp in the Church could be obtained before his untimely demise.
I must be missing part of the story here.
This is about the mission we were discussing earlier.
The bishop responsible for the case was a sympathizer of those who despise apostles.
But we're all followers of the same Goddess...
I'd long known there were those in the Church who didn't like us...but until now, they rarely visibly acted on that hate.
I investigated the bishop in this case, and learned that his dislike of angels and apostles began suddenly a few months ago.
Normally, one would assume there was an inciting incident to bring about such a drastic change of heart.
Any guesses as to what it was?
That was what I was hoping to make him tell us...but he offed himself before I could.
It sounded like the priest who was murdered had grown distrustful of him, and they started arguing a lot.
Eventually, he started to suspect that his life was in danger, and asked us for help... but we were too late to save him.
Then, the bishop decided to murder that priest and pin the crime on the apostle who came to aid his victim.
No doubt his aim was to weaken the apostles' standing in the Church.
But I find it hard to believe the bishop was the real root of all this. Someone else was pulling the strings.
A shame that our only lead is dead. Now we've got no way of finding out.
As soon as I laid eyes on that bishop, I knew he wanted to do me harm.
Even so, that animosity felt almost... surface-level. If only I'd had a proper conversation with him.
If only I wasn't such a coward, this might have ended better... I'm sorry.
Nobody's blaming you for this, Ryszarda.
Yeah. If anything, your unique qualities might've been what helped solve this.
What do you mean?
Your unnaturally sharp instincts come from how timid you are.
I'd argue there's nothing inherently bad about you being that way.
On this matter, I must agree.
Before I sent you cascading off that cliff, you understood what we wanted you to do from our words and expressions.
You could do that because you are always observing people. What you consider your weakness became your strength.
You're right that I could tell as soon as I saw you that you were just trying to get me away from the Templars.
But I think that was mostly because it was you two. Since we're...well, friends.
I could surmise your intentions without you putting them into words.
Now that's true trust in action! I'm a little jealous of you all.
I hope I can get to that point with the rest of you, too!
Well, I don't know how dependable I'll be...but it would be my pleasure.
Awesome!
A quick caveat, though: no matter how much you trust me, please don't go flinging me off of any cliffs. That's only okay with Ryszarda.
*sigh* Must you bring that up again?
This matter has been sufficiently discussed. Heed me—I must apprise you of your next mission.
I've always been more fainthearted than most, and have always hated that about myself.
But then Raphael told me to count on her and my friends, just like she depends on me.
That made realize that trust goes two ways. I don't just need my friends—they need me, too.
Simply knowing that is enough to quell my impulse to turn tail and run from everything. Probably. Maybe. I think.
That concludes my explanation. Fulfill your task in the Goddess's name.
Of course.
By Her name, it shall be done!
I might be a coward, but I'm not alone— because I have the other apostles by my side!
I won't let Her down!
